12240,Sign up via email & password,2024-02-13T02:49:32.400Z,Signup,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Signup Rejection for Improperly Formatted Email Address
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user enters ""<invalidEmail>"" as the email address
Then the form cannot be submitted
And a message about the improper email format should be displayed
Examples:
| invalidEmail        |
| plaintext           |
| @no-user.com        |
| user@.com.my        |
| user.name@domain    |
| user#@domain.co.in  |
| user@domain..com |
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Rejecting Signup with Duplicate Email
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user attempts to signup with an email that already has an account
And submits the signup form
Then the signup should be rejected
And a message to contact support should be displayed
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Viewing Terms of Service during Signup
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user clicks on the Terms of Service link
Then the Terms of Service are displayed
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Switching to Login from the Signup Flow
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user clicks on the login link
Then the login page should be displayed
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Signup with Weak Password Rejection
Given the user has successfully validated the email
And is now setting name and password
When the user enters a weak password
Then the signup form cannot be submitted
And a message about password requirements should be displayed",Active

column1: 789379,Driver created for first user in company,2024-10-23T06:10:23.152Z,Signup,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver created for sign up which created a new company

column1: 1532872,Verify email ownership,2025-09-05T14:54:21.173Z,Signup,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful email verification

column2: Given user submits a valid email address to sign up with
And  receives a verification code
When the user submits the correct verification code within its validity window
Then the user can proceed to setting User Name and Password
And gain access to the product afterwards

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enters an incorrect verification code

column2: Given the verification code is invalid
When the user submits the code
Then the system rejects the attempt
And gives user feedback about the failed attempt

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Contact support if verification fails

column2: Given the submitted code was expired or invalid
And the verification fails
Then the user can contact support directly from the failure feedback

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Verification code expires

column2: Given the validity period of the code has passed
When the user submits that code
Then the system rejects the code
And gives user feedback about the failed attempt

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Resend Verification Code

column2: Given the user has already received a verification code during signup
And there is no ongoing cooldown period
When the user requests a new verification code
Then a new verification code is generated and sent to the user
And all previously issued codes are invalidated
And the user is shown feedback indicating the remaining cooldown time

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Request new verification code during cooldown period

column2: Given the user has requested a new verification code
When the user attempts to request another code before the cooldown completes
Then the user is not allowed to request another code A

column1: ",Active
14,User can login to app,2024-01-31T03:06:04.902Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful login

column2: Given user has signed up
When the user attempts to login with valid credentials
Then the user is logged into the application
And is navigated to the default workspace and routes page

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Redirect to app when already authenticated

column2: Given a user has already logged in
And their login has not yet expired
When they navigate to the login page
Then they are redirected to the routes page and default workspace

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User redirects to where they navigated to when interrupted by login flow

column2: Given a user is not logged in

column1: And the user tries to visit a specific '<protected_view>'
When the user logs in
Then the user is redirected to the specific requested view
Examples:
| protected_view |
| drivers page   |
| routes page    |
| settings page |
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Tracking login event

column2: Given a user is on the login page
When a user sucessfully logs in
Then a 'Signed In' event should be tracked
And their user profile should be updated with their latest user information
And their company profile should be updated with the latest company information",Active

column1: 15,Unauthenticated users cannot access app,2024-01-31T03:06:04.905Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unsuccessful login

column2: When the user attempts to login with valid credentials
Then the user is presented with an error message that they cannot login due to invalid credentials

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Redirect to login when unauthenticated

column2: Given a user has already logged in
And their login has expired
When they navigate to the application
Then they are redirected to the login page",Active

column1: 12242,User can switch to create account instead,2024-02-13T02:55:39.584Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Switching to Signup from the Login Flow
Given the user is on the login page
When the user clicks on the signup link
Then the signup page should be displayed",Active

53242,User is redirected by the system to the applicable view,2024-02-20T17:35:24.095Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Default to last viewed workspace and date
Given a user has viewed routes on a specific date
And has closed the application
When the user visits the application without specifying a path
Then the user is taken to their last viewed workspace and last viewed date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Fallback to oldest workspace and today's date
Given a user is logged in and their oldest workspace has no routes
And the user has no last viewed workspace or date
When the user visits the application without specifying a URL
Then the user is redirected to their oldest workspace on today's date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Logged in user with no specified workspace or date
Given a user is logged in and their oldest workspace has routes scheduled
And the user has no last viewed workspace or date
When the user visits the application without specifying a URL
Then the user is redirected to their oldest workspace on the latest date with routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User in a workspace with no stored last viewed date
Given the user has no stored last viewed date
When a user logs into a specific workspace
Then the system falls back to the most recent date with routes in that workspace
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: No routes available on any date
Given a user is logged in and in a specific workspace
And there are no routes available on any date for the user's workspace
When the system determines the routing
Then the user is redirected to the default routing view on today's date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Navigating to an exact workspace, date, and view via URL
Given a user is logged in
When the user navigates to an exact workspace, date, and view via URL
Then the application takes the user to that exact workspace, date, and view",Active

column1: 75772,User can logout,2024-03-01T00:09:43.936Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Logged out user can not access protected resources

column2: Given a user logs out

And should be redirected to the login page

| Routes Page        | /workspace/{workspace_id}/routes   |
",Active
126972,User can go back to v2 from v3 login page,2024-03-26T00:48:37.615Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Going back to v2 login

column1: 1561534,Verify Email for existing users,2025-09-26T20:27:23.698Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unverified user cannot use web app

column2: Given a user is unverified
When they log into the web app
Then there will be a blocking modal prompting them to verify
And they can request a verification code
And they cannot access the app

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing user can verify email

column2: Given a user is unverified
And has a valid verification code
When they log into the web app
And input their verification code
Then their account will be verified
And they will be able to access the rest of the app

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unverified drivers can still access mobile
Given a user is unverified

column2: When they log into the mobile app

column1: Then they can use the mobile app as normal
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unverified account can still use API integration
Given an unverified user account
And they see a blocking modal when they log in on the web app but don't verify
Then they can use the API integration as normal",Active

1775709,Driver accidentally logging in will be guided,2026-01-06T21:26:45.674Z,Authentication,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver accidentally logging into web app
Given a user with only driver permissions
When they log into the web app
Then we will show guidance to download and use the mobile app instead
And there will be an explanation that if they need dispatcher access, they should reach out to their admin",Draft
16,Requesting password reset,2024-01-31T03:06:04.906Z,Password Reset,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reset password for a valid email

column2: Given a user has an account previously created
When user requests a password reset with a valid email
Then the user should receive an email with instructions to reset their password
And the name of the sender should be 'Routific'
And the user can reset their account's password by following the link in the email

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reset password for an invalid email

column2: When a user requests a password reset for an email not linked to any Routific account
Then the user should not receive a password reset email",Active

column1: 20,Update password from reset page,2024-01-31T03:06:04.912Z,Password Reset,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update password and login

column2: Given the user received a password reset email
When the user follows the reset links and updates their password
Then the user receives a success notification email
And is able to login to the app using the new password",Active

column1: 1775708,Seeing my information on the account settings page,2026-01-06T21:19:11.262Z,Account Settings,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Navigating to the Accounts Settings page

1835091,Existing user can accept invitation to join a company on web,2026-01-21T15:49:58.218Z,Join Company,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing user can see invite to join another company on web app
Given a user has a Routific account
And they have a pending invite
When they log in on the web app or their page is refreshed while logged in
Then they see a notification on the account button in the nav bar
And an invitation in their account settings page
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Accept invite from existing account
Given a user has a Routific account
When they accept a pending invite
Then their org is updated to the inviting org
And their roles are replaced with the roles in the invite
And any driver profiles associated with past orgs are disconnected from their user
And they are logged out and taken to the Login screen",Active
924,Supported upload formats,2024-02-02T06:18:36.699Z,CSV Upload,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload orders in supported file formats

column2: When a user uploads orders in supported file formats of csv or xlsx
Then orders are successfully created
And an Orders Created analytics event is triggered

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload CSV files with comma separation
Given the user has a CSV file with comma separated data
When the user uploads that CSV file
Then they should not see any errors about delimeter usage
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload CSV files with semicolon separation
Given the user has a CSV file with semicolon separated data
When the user uploads that CSV file
Then they should not see any errors about delimeter usage
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reject CSV files with mixed delimiter characters
Given the user has a CSV file with mixed delimiter characters, such as commas and semicolons
When the user attempts to upload the CSV file
Then the system should reject the file
And display an error message indicating invalid delimiter usage",Active

912,Download example template for uploading orders,2024-02-02T05:30:08.554Z,CSV Upload,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can download a sample CSV for uploading orders

column2: Given the user has no unscheduled orders for the selected date
When the user navigates to the unscheduled orders tray in route page
Then the user can view an option to download sample orders file",Active

column1: 926,Cannot upload invalid CSV files,2024-02-02T06:32:30.736Z,CSV Upload,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reject CSV files with empty header rows
Given the user has a CSV file no data in the first row
When the user attempts to upload the CSV file
Then the system should reject the file
And display an error message indicating that the first row cannot be empty
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reject CSV files with metadata above the header row
Given the user has a CSV file with metadata above the header row
When the user uploads the CSV file
Then the first row's data will be used to show which columns are available for upload
",Active

1436651,View orders immediately after upload,2025-07-31T18:00:18.852Z,CSV Upload,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can see orders have been created while they are geocoding
When a user uploads a list of orders
Then they will see those orders immediately
And which ones are still geocoding",Active

1674140,Map columns for first time upload,2025-11-21T18:25:54.307Z,Mapping uploaded data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can map columns to order fields during first time upload

column2: Given a new workspace is created
When user uploads an orders csv file
Then the user is prompted to map order fields to file columns",Active

column1: 41,Previous mapping is applied when no new fields are detected,2024-01-31T03:06:04.959Z,Mapping uploaded data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Skip mapping when a file is recognized

column2: Given the user has existing CSV mappings
And the CSV has no errors
When the user submits orders for creation
Then they should be able to see their created orders

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Multiple columns match a mapped field
Given a user has an order file format with two ""Customer Address"" fields
And they have mapped one of those columns to Routic's ""Address"" field
When the user uploads an order file with the same format
// Same format is defined by the column headers names and sequence being identical
Then their column mapping should be remembered
And they are not asked to map their data again
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Mapped columns are remembered when column sequence changes
Given a user has an order file format with ""Customer Address""
And ""Customer Address"" is the first column in their file format
And has mapped ""Customer Address"" to Routific's ""Address"" field
When the user changes the ""Customer Address"" to be the second column in their file format
And uploads the order file
Then ""Customer Address"" should be remembered as mapped to ""Address""
And they should not be asked to map their data again.
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Remember overrides of default mappings
Given a user has an order file format containing ""Customer Address"" and ""Address"" columns
And they have previously mapped ""Customer Address"" to Routific's ""Address"" field
When they upload the same file format again
Then ""Customer Address"" should be remembered as mapped to ""Address""
And they should not be asked to map their data again.",Active

921,User can see data errors in orders they uploaded,2024-02-02T06:09:09.596Z,Managing errors in uploaded data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can see the data errors in uploaded orders
Given a spreadsheet uploaded with orders
And at least one of the orders has data incompatible with the mapped field
And the spreadsheet has been mapped
When the user uploads it
Then they see a list of orders with data errors
And they can edit the data on screen to fix the errors",Active

923,User can go back to remap their columns when fixing data errors,2024-02-02T06:17:07.987Z,Managing errors in uploaded data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can go back to mapping step during upload
Given a user has uploaded a file without a recognized mapping
And some of the rows have errors
When they are reviewing errors
Then the user can go back to update the mapping",Active

922,User can navigate errors in their data using keyboard shortcuts,2024-02-02T06:14:49.893Z,Managing errors in uploaded data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scanrio: Navigating through rows and columns when fixing spreadsheet upload errors

column2: Given the user has uploaded a spreadsheet with incompatible data
When user attempts to fix these errors
Then the user should be able navigate through the rows and columns using key board shortcuts of tab, shift+tab, enter, shift+enter.",Active

column1: 911,User can upload poorly formatted file of orders,2024-02-02T05:10:10.616Z,Managing errors in uploaded data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Ignore empty lines in the CSV file
Given the user has an order file with empty lines
When the user uploads the file
Then the system should remove any empty lines
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Ignore leading and trailing whitespace characters
Given the user has an order file with leading and trailing whitespaces in data cells
When the user uploads the file
Then the system should remove the leading and trailing whitespaces in the data
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Ignore columns with empty header cells
Given the user has an order file with an empty cell in the first row
When the user tries to upload the file
Then we ignore that column
And allow the upload to proceed with the data in columns that have headers",Active

326675,User can upload csv with errors in some rows,2024-06-03T18:11:49.492Z,Managing errors in uploaded data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario:Some rows in the mapped CSV has errors

column2: Given the user uploaded a CSV file where some the rows have errors
And they are shown the errored rows upon submission
When user chooses to continue uploading without fixing all the errored rows
Then the errored rows are discarded
And only the good rows are submitted for order creation

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reject order CSV upload if all rows have errors

column2: Given the user has a CSV file where all the rows have errors
When the user attempts to upload the file
The user is blocked from proceeding to create orders",Active

column1: 39,User can upload orders with custom field data,2024-01-31T03:06:04.956Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can upload orders with custom field data

When uploading the spreadsheet of orders

column1: 913,User can upload orders containing questionable addresses,2024-02-02T05:31:03.742Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can upload orders with questionable addresses

column2: Given user has a spreadsheet with questionable addresses

column1: 914,User can upload orders containing invalid addresses,2024-02-02T05:31:10.620Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can upload orders with invalid addresses

column1: 915,Upload orders with addresses split into multiple fields,2024-02-02T05:31:38.697Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can upload orders with address information mapped to different columns

column2: Given the orders spreadsheet has address information split into multiple columns
When uploading the spreadsheet of orders

column1: 918,Uploading orders with lat/lng or addresses,2024-02-02T05:49:28.358Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload orders with address and no lat/lng

column2: Given an order has an address string
When the user uploads the CSV
Then CSV upload should be successful
And the address should be geocoded

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload orders with lat/lng and no address

column2: Given an order has valid lat/lng and no address
When the user uploads the CSV
Then CSV upload should be successful

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload orders with lat/lng and address

column2: Given an order has valid lat/lng and an address
When the user uploads the CSV
Then the upload should be successful
But the addresses are not geocoded
And the suppled lat/lng are used instead

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload orders with a lat but no lng

column2: Given an order has lat but no lng
When the user uploads the CSV
Then CSV upload should result in an error

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload orders with a lng but no lat

column2: Given an order has lng but no lat
When the user uploads the CSV
Then CSV upload should result in an error

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Upload rejected when an order has no valid location data

column2: Given an order has no address or valid lat/lng
When the user uploads the CSV
Then CSV upload should be blocked and flag the error row",Active

column1: 919,Uploading orders with phone numbers,2024-02-02T05:53:59.987Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Assuming country code for phone numbers based on user's IP location
Given a user has a file of orders to upload
And the file contains an order with a phone number lacking a country code
When the user uploads the file
Then the system should assume the country code based on the user's IP location
And the phone number is peresisted and normalized according to the E.164 format
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Uploading an order with a phone number having a foreign country code
Given the user has a file of orders
And the file contains an order with a phone number including a foreign country code
When the user uploads that file
Then the system should correctly process the phone number with the provided foreign country code

925,User can upload orders with time windows,2024-02-02T06:29:35.492Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Accept overnight time windows in orders

column1: 1238076,User can upload orders with a delivery date,2025-05-30T17:56:26.445Z,Supported order data,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can upload orders with a delivery date

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invalid dates show accepted formats
Given a user's organization date format preference is set to Auto
When I upload a CSV file that includes invalid delivery dates
Then Routific shows an error message indicating which rows are invalid
And the message lists the accepted formats for correction
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routific automatically identifies the correct format

column2: Given a user's organization preference for date format is set to Auto
And the CSV file consistently uses one date format
When the user uploads the file
Then Routific automatically detects the correct format
And completes the upload successfully

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block""> Scenario: Date format auto detection fails and falls back to browser locale
Given a user's organization date format preference is set to Auto
And the CSV has ambiguous dates that could match more than one format
When I upload the file
And Routific can automatically detect the right format based on my browser locale
And completes the upload successfully
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Default date format behavior for new organizations
Given a user's organization has never set a date format preference
When I upload a CSV with any supported date format
Then Routific automatically detects the correct format
And creates the orders successfully
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block""> Scenario: Organization preference is respected for ambiguous dates
Given a user's organization date format preference is set to a non-automatic prefernce
When I upload a CSV file with dates that could be interpreted as ambigious
Then Routific interprets the ambigious dates based on the organization's prefernce
And the orders are created without errors
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block""> Scenario: Routific retries failed validations against other supported formats
Given a user's organization date format preference is set to a non-automatic preference
When I upload a CSV file with dates that do not match the prescribed preference
Then Routific can automatically interpret the dates through other supported formats
And create the orders without errors",Active

column1: 437231,View Orders Page,2024-07-08T14:09:35.834Z,Viewing Orders,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View orders in my workspace

Then they will see all orders sorted by most recently created first
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Empty orders page
Given a user has no orders in a workspace
When they navigate to the orders page
Then they will see that they have no orders yet
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can view orders via table pagination

column2: Given a user has over 101 orders in a workspace

Then they will see the second set of orders

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can refresh the page while viewing different order pages.

column2: Given a user has over 101 orders in a workspace and is viewing the second page.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can view order details via the ODP.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can view order details via the ODP when refreshing the page.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User receives concurrent addition of orders when on page 1 of the orders table.

column2: Given a user is on page 1 of the orders table.

Then the table will automatically show the new order

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User does not automatically see new orders when not on page 1 of the orders table.

column2: Given a user is on a page greater than 1.

Then the table will not update to reflect the new order.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User receives concurrent updates when viewing the orders table.

column2: Given a user is viewing the orders table
When a concurrent order(s) is updated
Then the table will automatically update to show the changes; Without reloading the table.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User receives concurrent order deletions when viewing the orders table.

column2: Given a user is viewing the orders table
When a concurrent order(s) is deleted that the user is viewing
Then the table will automatically remove that order, close the ODP and remove from the URL params the order ID. ",Active

| Invoice | 4156 | 4156 ",Active

column1: 461803,User can edit order coordinates,2024-07-24T20:09:47.307Z,Editing Orders,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User cannot save invalid lat/lng coordinates

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can manually set the location of the order by specifying coordinates

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can add text in the address field to be used as a label for chosen coordinates

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Switching from use address tab to use precise location should preserve the location details

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Updating the pin location should automatically switch to use precise location tab

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Order modal renders ""use address"" tab if the uploaded order via csv was using address only

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Order modal renders ""use precise location"" tab if the uploaded order via csv using lat/lng information

column1: 888,Assign single order to specific route,2024-02-01T06:46:47.934Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Assign an order to an empty route
Given a route exists with no orders scheduled to it
When a user selects an order
And chooses that route to schedule it to
Then the order is scheduled to the route
And usage is increased for that order as long as it has never been scheduled before
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">  Scenario: Schedule a single order to existing route
Given there is exactly 1 unscheduled order to be scheduled
When the user attempts to schedule it to an existing route with orders
Then Routific schedules the order into the route without changing the existing sequence
And usage is increased for that order as long as it has never been scheduled before
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scheduling less than 10% of orders into existing route

column2: Given there are unscheduled orders to be scheduled
And the ratio of unscheduled orders to all scheduled orders is less than 10%
When the user schedules the new orders to an existing route/s
Then Routific schedules the orders into routes without changing the existing sequence

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scheduling more than 10% of orders into existing route

column2: Given there are unscheduled orders to be scheduled
And the ratio of unscheduled orders to all scheduled orders is more than 10%
When the user schedules the new orders to an existing route
Then the user has an option to choose between inserting the orders without re-optimizing existing route
Or scheduling the new orders by re-optimizing the existing route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unable to assign an order currently being scheduled
Given an order is currently being scheduled to a route on a day
When a user selects the same order
Then the user cannot schedule it
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Cannot schedule an order to a completed route
Given the user has a completed route
When a user selects an order
Then the user cannot choose a completed route to schedule the order
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule an order with an overnight time window
Given there is an order with a time window where the start time is before midnight, and the end time is after midnight
And there is a route which can accommodate that order at any time during its time window
When a user selects that order
And chooses that route to schedule it to
Then the order is scheduled to the route
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Loading state and optimization notification
When a user chooses to schedule order/s to a specific route
And a scheduling action is triggered
Then the user is notified via a visual affordance that an active optimization is in-progress
And a success or failure notification is presented to user at the end of the scheduling action.",Active

889,Assign selection of orders to specific route,2024-02-01T06:51:34.044Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can assign multiple orders to an empty route
Given there is an empty route
And optimization constraints are relaxed
When the user selects multiple orders
And chooses that route to schedule them
Then all selected orders are scheduled to the route
And usage is increased for any orders which have never been scheduled before
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can assign multiple orders to a route with orders scheduled
Given there is a route with scheduled orders
And optimization constraints are relaxed
When the user selects multiple orders
And chooses that route to schedule them
Then all selected orders are scheduled to the route
And usage is increased for any orders which have never been scheduled before
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can assign orders to a route resulting in a reoptimization
Given there is a route with 10 scheduled orders
When the user selects 5 unscheduled orders
And chooses that route to schedule them
Then the orders are assigned to the route
And the route is reoptimized by respecting scheduling constraints
And usage is increased for any orders which have never been scheduled before",Draft

1674137,Assign selection of orders to multiple routes,2025-11-18T17:32:04.226Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Assign an uscheduled order to multiple routes
Given multiple routes exists
When a user selects an unscheduled order
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to schedule it to multiple routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Assign a scheduled order to multiple routes
Given multiple routes exists
When a user selects an unscheduled order
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to schedule it to multiple routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Assign multiple orders to multiple routes
Given multiple routes exists
When a user lassos some orders
And chooses to schedule them
Then the user has the option to schedule them to multiple routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Can schedule a mix of scheduled and unscheduled orders to multiple routes
Given multiple routes exists
When a user selects a mix of scheduled and unscheduled orders
And chooses to schedule them
Then the user has the option to schedule them to a single route only
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can partially assign selection of orders to routes
Given routes exists with orders
And routes have some availability to take on new orders
And optimization prefrences are set to strict
When a user selects a selection of unscheduled orders
And chooses to schedule them via scheduling flow through insertion or re-optimization
Then only partial set of orders should be successfully scheduled
And remaining orders should stay unscheduled
And partial success notification is visible to the user
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Can undo scheduling action if multiple routes are involved and insert operation is selected
Given multiple routes exists
When a user schedules an unscheduled order to multiple routes using insertion
Then the user can undo+redo this operation
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Can choose between reoptimize and insertion
Given multiple routes exists
When a user selects multiple unscheduled orders to schedule to them (via lasso/multiselect)
Then they are offered the option to reoptimize or insert for scheduling
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: (NOT SUPPORTED ATM) Cannot undo scheduling action if multiple routes are involved and reoptimize operation is selected
Given multiple routes exists
When a user schedules an unscheduled order to multiple routesusing reoptimization
Then the user cannot undo+redo this operation",Active

898,Schedule all orders to all available routes,2024-02-01T07:15:00.491Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can schedule all orders when there is enough available shift time
Given there are routes with enough available shift time
When a user schedules all unscheduled orders
Then all orders are scheduled into the existing routes
And usage is increased for any orders which have never been scheduled before
And an Orders Scheduled analytics event is triggered with scheduling metadata
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User cannot schedule all orders to published routes
Given there is a mix of unpublished and published routes on a day
When a user schedules all unscheduled orders
Then orders are only scheduled into the unpublished routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule orders with and without delivery date to routes

column2: Given a user has orders with and without specific delivery date
When the user chooses to schedule all orders for a day
Then Routific will schedule orders with matching delivery date and those without a delivery date.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can successfully schedule subset of orders without violating constraints

column2: Given there are new orders to schedule
And there are existing routes with orders
And the scheduling constraint preferences are set to strict
When I try to schedule all new orders into these existing routes
And if only a subset of the orders can be scheduled without violating constraints
Then I see a partial success notification that only a subset of orders were successfully scheduled",Draft

32766,User can schedule orders with route templates,2024-02-14T22:07:50.808Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routes are created from templates during scheduling when there are no routes on a day

column2: Given at least one active template in the workspace
And no pre-published routes
When a user schedules all unscheduled orders
Then routes are created using templates
And orders are scheduled into those
And usage is increased for all scheduled orders which have never been scheduled before

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario:  Scheduling with manually created routes is deterministic
Given a user has some orders previously scheduled to some routes using templates
And the user deletes those routes
When a user recreates the same number of routes manually as that were deleted
And schedules orders to these routes
Then the solution returned by Routific should be identical to the routes that were deleted",Draft

32764,User cannot schedule an order to an incompatible route,2024-02-14T14:39:59.064Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"

Scenario: User cannot schedule an order to a route with incompatible shift time
 Given a route has a shift time
 And an unscheduled order has a time window that does not overlap with the route's shift time
 When the user schedules the order to the route
 Then the order remains unscheduled
 And the user sees an error message
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User cannot schedule an order to a route that cannot be reached by car

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can schedule a mix of compatible and incompatible orders

122874,Free plan users have limits to scheduling,2024-03-20T19:57:01.379Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block scheduling when it would exceed monthly orders limit
Given a company is on the free plan
And a user has some orders which have never been scheduled
And the number of those orders exceeds the remaining free order limit
When they attempt to schedule those orders to a day
Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block order scheduling when monthly limit is reached
Given a company is on the free plan
And 100 orders have already been scheduled this billing period
When a user attempts to assign a never-scheduled order to a route
Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block scheduling to selected route when it would exceed monthly orders limit
Given a company is on the free plan
And a user has selected some orders which have never been scheduled
And the number of those orders exceeds the remaining free order limit
When they attempt to assign those orders to a route
Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block scheduling when it would exceed monthly orders limit
Given a company is on the free plan
And a user has lassoed some orders which have never been scheduled
And the number of those orders exceeds the remaining free order limit
When they attempt to drop those orders to schedule them to a route
Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales",Draft

648101,Routific can determine the optimal start time for the route,2024-09-20T17:50:44.244Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enables flexible start time option without time windows

column2: Given that none of the orders have a time-window constraint
And routes have start time assigned
And flexible start time option is enabled
When user schedules orders to routes
Then all routes begin at the start time specified on the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enables flexible start time option with time windows

column2: Given that all orders have a time-window constraint
And flexible start time option is enabled
When user schedules orders to routes
Then all the routes begin at the most optimal time based on the time windows of the orders that minimizes any idle time in the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enables flexible start time option with time of day predicted traffic

column2: Given that orders may or may not have a time-window constraint
And flexible start time option is enabled
When user schedules orders to routes with time of day predicted traffic option
Then routes optimal start time is determined based on time of day predicted traffic conditions ",Draft

column1: 1674139,User can schedule subset of orders into mix of published routes,2025-11-20T23:27:55.857Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule single order to a single published route
Given any non-completed order and a published route
When a user selects the order
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to select a published route
And the order will be best-inserted
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule multiple orders to a single published route
Given a selection of non-completed orders and a published route
When a user chooses to schedule them
Then the user has the option to select a published route
And the orders will be best-inserted
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule single order to a mix of published and unpublished routes
Given any non-completed order and a mix of published and unpublished routes
When a user selects the order
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to select a mix of published and unpublished routes
And the order will be best-inserted into the subset of selected routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule multiple orders to a mix of published and unpublished routes
Given a selection of non-completed orders and a mix of published and unpublished routes
When a user chooses to schedule them
Then the user has the option to select a mix of published and unpublished routes
And the orders will be best-inserted into the subset of selected routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule All with a mix of published and unpublished routes
Given some unscheduled and a mix of published and unpublished routes
When a user chooses to ""schedule all"" or ""plan routes""
Then the user has no option to select a subset of routes
When the user proceeds with scheduling
Then the orders will only be scheduled to unpublished routes.",Draft

1684376,User can schedule mix of scheduled and unscheduled orders into multiple routes,2025-11-25T22:35:24.095Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule mix of scheduled and unscheduled to multiple routes
Given scheduled routes and some unscheduled orders
When a user selects the unscheduled together with orders that were scheduled
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to select multiple routes to schedule it into
And all selected orders will be scheduled to those routes

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule mix of scheduled and unscheduled to multiple routes, while leaving already scheduled orders alone in the target routes
Given scheduled routes and some unscheduled orders
When a user selects the unscheduled together with orders that were scheduled
And chooses to schedule it
And the user selects a target route that includes a selected scheduled order
Then the scheduling action will leave the selected order where it was
And schedule the rest
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule scheduled order to multiple routes
Given a schedule order and multiple routes
When a user selects the scheduled
And chooses to reschedule it from the ODP
Then the user has the option to select multiple routes to schedule it into
And the order will be scheduled to one of those routes",Draft

75,Drag and drop selected orders to another route,2024-01-31T03:06:05.009Z,Scheduling orders to routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Moving orders into another route

895,User can unschedule an order,2024-02-01T07:09:58.280Z,Unscheduling orders,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unscheduled orders with delivery date from route

column2: Given a route exists with orders containing delivery date
When the dispatchers deletes the route or unschedules the orders from the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: unscheduling order/s with delivery date in the past

column2: Given a route exists with delivery date of orders in the past
When the route is deleted or orders are unscheduled from the route
Then the user is given an option to navigate to the oldest delivery date of unscheduled orders

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: unscheduling order/s with delivery date in the future

column2: Given a route exists with delivery date of orders in the future

Then the user is given an option to navigate to the earliest delivery date of unscheduled orders

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: unscheduling order/s with a mix of delivery dates in the past and future

column2: Given a route exists with a mix of delivery date of orders in the past and future
When the route is deleted or orders are unscheduled from the route
Then the user is given an option to navigate to the oldest delivery date of unscheduled orders

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: unscheduling order/s with a delivery date that matches current selected date

column2: Given a route exists with delivery date of orders that matches the routes scheduled date
When the route is deleted or orders are unscheduled from the route
Then the unscheduled orders are visible in the unscheduled tray of orders

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: unscheduling orders with and without delivery dates in the past or future

column2: Given a route exists with and without delivery dates for orders
And the orders with delivery dates are in the past or future

Then the user is given an option to navigate to the earliest delivery date of unscheduled orders",Active

928,Resolving route conflicts between dispatcher and driver,2024-02-02T07:07:59.134Z,Modifying Schedule for Live Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver's completion of a stop overrides dispatcher's removal of the same stop
Given the dispatcher is making changes to a driver's route
And the driver is actively completing stops on the route
When the dispatcher removes a stop from the route
And the driver completes the same stop before the driver receives that change
Then the system should record the stop as completed
And maintain the stop on the driver's route despite removal by the dispatcher
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher's reassignment of a stop overridden by driver's completion
Given the dispatcher is making changes to a driver's route
And the driver is actively completing stops on that route
When the dispatcher moves a stop to a different route
And the driver completes that stop before the driver receives that change
Then the system should record the stop as completed on the original driver's route
And disregard the dispatcher's reassignment of the stop
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher's optimization action overridden by driver's completion of a stop
Given the dispatcher is making changes to a driver's route
And the driver is actively completing stops on that route
When the dispatcher unschedules a stop from the driver's route
And starts an optimization with the unscheduled stop
And the driver completes that stop before they receive the changes to their route
Then the system should record the stop as completed on the driver's route
And disregard the dispatcher's optimization action on the stop
",Draft

900,User can schedule orders with loads to routes,2024-02-01T07:19:02.593Z,Scheduling orders with constraints,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: schedule orders with load to routes with capacity

1491924,User can access optimization preferences,2025-08-29T16:51:47.196Z,Optimization Preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Read-only user cannot edit any optimization preferences

column2: When the read-only user accesses optimization preference settings
Then the user will only be able to view the current state of the preferences
And is not able to change any of the optimization preferences

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User with dispatcher role can manage any optimization preferences

column2: When a user with dispatcher roles accesses optimization preferences page for a workspace
Then the user has access to manage any of the preferences under the workspace",Draft

column1: 1491925,User can see reason for unserved orders,2025-08-29T16:53:36.253Z,Optimization Preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Order is left unserved due to constraint violation

column2: Given that there are order/s being scheduled to routes
And scheduling constraint/s are set to strict
When none of the orders could be scheduled to the routes
Then the user sees a notification with a specific reason on why the orders could not be scheduled",Draft

column1: 1547202,User can manage overtime perference,2025-09-11T21:23:10.007Z,Optimization Preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with relaxed overtime preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without overtime violations
And the overtime constraint is set to relaxed
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule all orders into existing routes
And notify the dispatcher that all orders were successfully scheduled

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with strict overtime preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without overtime violations
And the overtime constraint is set to strict
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule as many orders as possible into existing routes without worsening any existing overtime violations
And notify the dispatcher how many orders were successfully scheduled

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: All orders left unserved due to strict overtime preference

column2: Given that the dispatcher has order/s being scheduled into routes
And overtime constraint is set to strict
When none of the orders could be scheduled to routes due to violation of shift times
Then the user sees a notification that the orders could not be scheduled due to preference for no overtime ",Draft

column1: 1547203,User can manage lateness preference,2025-09-11T21:23:16.534Z,Optimization Preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with relaxed lateness preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without lateness violations
And the lateness constraint is set to relaxed
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule all orders into existing routes
And notify the dispatcher that all orders were successfully scheduled

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with strict lateness preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without lateness violations
And the lateness constraint is set to strict
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule as many orders as possible into existing routes without worsening any existing lateness violations
And notify the dispatcher how many orders were successfully scheduled

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: All orders left unserved due to strict lateness preference

column2: Given that the dispatcher has order/s being scheduled into routes
And lateness constraint is set to strict
When none of the orders could be scheduled to routes due to violation of time windows
Then the user sees a notification that the orders could not be scheduled due to preference for no lateness ",Draft

column1: 1547204,User can manage overcapacity preference,2025-09-11T21:23:31.489Z,Optimization Preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with relaxed overcapacity preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without capacity violations
And the overtime constraint is set to relaxed
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule all orders into existing routes
And notify the dispatcher that all orders were successfully scheduled

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with strict overcapacity preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without capacity violations
And the overcapacity constraint is set to strict
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule as many orders as possible into existing routes without worsening any existing capacity violations
And notify the dispatcher how many orders were successfully scheduled

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: All orders left unserved due to strict capacity preference

column2: Given that the dispatcher has order/s being scheduled into routes
And capacity constraint is set to strict
When none of the orders could be scheduled to routes due to capacity violations
Then the user sees a notification that the orders could not be scheduled due to preference for no overcapacity ",Draft

column1: 1835095,Return default solver solution when GPU solver is unavailable,2026-01-21T22:44:46.905Z,Failure Handling,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: (Only on dev + staging) Return LS solution to the user when GPU worker unavailable
Given there are no GA workers provisioned
And the organization is opted into competing solver architecture
When the dispatcher triggers a scheduling action that generally completes within 1 min

Then Routific returns the LS solution given that the GA worker is unavailable

Note:

  • This scenario can only be tested in dev and stg because these environments have underprovisioned GPU workers meaning they get spun up on-demand, which takes roughly 2-3 mins. This means that for a small enough problem LS solution is returned because the GA worker doesn't get spun up on time, which mimic ga worker unavailability case.
  • On Prod, there's always bound to be a GA worker provisioned 24/7 so this test cannot be executed consistently in a predictive manner.
  • stg url to check if GA worker is available.
",Draft

55,User can manually add routes from saved route templates,2024-01-31T03:06:04.978Z,Adding Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can create a route from a template
Given templates exist
When a user starts the flow to add routes from templates
Then they can select a template to use for creating a route
And after submitting, a route will be created using the template's constraints
And the route will be named based on the template used
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can create multiple routes from templates
Given templates exist
When a user starts the flow to add routes from templates
Then they can select the same template multiple times to create multiple routes
And they can select different templates
And after submitting, all the routes will be created using the templates' constraints
And the routes will be named based on the templates used",Draft

1698706,User can duplicate one or more routes,2025-11-26T05:16:20.773Z,Adding Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate one or more non-empty routes
Given the user has selected one or more non-empty routes ( upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of the active version of the routes placed on the selected date
And all the stops, sequence, order metadata and ETAs on the replicas are the same as the originals
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate one or more empty routes
Given the user has selected one or more empty routes (upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of the empty routes placed on the selected date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate one or more routes with unpublished changes
Given the user has selected one or more routes with unpublished changes (upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of the active version of the routes including the unpublished changes placed on the selected date
And all the stops, sequence, order metadata and ETAs on the replicas are the same as the originals
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate multiple routes in a single action
Given the user has selected multiple routes (upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of all the selected routes placed on the selected date
And all the stops, sequence, order metadata and ETAs on the replicas are the same as the originals
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Prevent duplicating more than 10 routes at once
Given the user has selected more than 10 routes
When they choose to duplicate them
Then the duplication request fails
And the user is informed that more than 10 routes cannot be duplicated at once
",Draft

98296,User can access Routes page,2024-03-12T22:18:31.214Z,Viewing Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User is taken back to last opened workspace and date

Then the user is redirected to their oldest workspace on today's date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User accesses routes page from different computer

column2: Given a user was viewing a workspace on one computer
When they navigate to the route page from a different computer
Then the user should be navigated to the latest date that contains routes",Draft

789382,User can toggle stop markers on the map,2024-10-24T16:15:40.361Z,Viewing Routes on Map,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User toggles stop markers for the first time

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
When the user presses the stop marker toggle button
Then the user can see stop markers above all of their orders
When the user refreshes their browser
Then they continue to see stop markers above their orders

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User toggles stop markers off

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And the user has stop markers turned on
When the user presses the stop marker toggle button
Then the user sees the scatterplot icons for their orders on their routes
When the user refreshes their browser
Then they continue to see scatterplot icons on their routes

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User selects a route with stop markers toggled off

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have scatterplot icons
When the user deselects the selected route
Then all routes have scatterplot icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User selects a route with stop markers toggled on

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have stop marker icons
When the user deselects the selected route
Then all routes have stop marker icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User toggles marker icons on while a route is selected

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned off
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have scatterplot icons
When the user presses the marker toggle button
Then the selected route stays selected
And all routes have stop marker icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User toggles marker icons off while a route is selected

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned on
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have stop marker icons
When the user presses the marker toggle button
Then the selected route stays selected
And all unselected routes have scatterplot icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User uses lasso tool while stop markers are turned on

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned on
When the user activates the lasso tool
Then the stop marker icons are toggled off while the tool is active
When the user deactivates the lasso tool
Then the stop markers reappear

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User drags and drops a stop while stop markers are turned on

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned on
When the user tries to drag and drop a stop to another route
Then the stop marker icons are toggled off while the user is dragging the stop
When the user stops dragging the stop
Then the stop markers reappear",Draft

column1: 864262,Map pans and zooms to show routes,2024-11-28T14:44:42.070Z,Viewing Routes on Map,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Show all routes on the map from the calendar view
Given routes exist on this day
When the user navigates into the day from the calendar view
Then the map will show all routes on that day within view, including stops, start, and end locations
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Maps pans when selecting a route from the timeline or list view
Given routes exist on this day
When the user selects a route from the timeline or list view
Then the route will go into its selected state
And the RDP opens
And the map will center on the selected route and zoom out to fit the route if any stops or start/end locations are out of view
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Map does not pan or zoom when selecting a route from the map
Given routes exist on this day
When the user selects a route from the map
Then the route will go into its selected state
And the RDP will open
And the map will not pan or zoom
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Maps pans to show multiselected routes
Given routes exist on this day
When the user multiselects 2+ routes from the timeline or list view
Then the routes will go into a selected state
And the RDP will remain closed
And the map will center on the selected routes
And the map will zoom out to fit all routes if out of view
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Map does not pan or zoom when multi-selecting routes from the map
Given routes exist on this day
When the user multiselects 2+ routes from the map
Then the routes will go into a selected state
And the RDP will remain closed
And the map will not pan or zoom",Draft

133115,User can edit route,2024-03-26T21:48:33.107Z,Modifying Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update route name

column2: Given a user has a non-published route
When the user updates the route name
Then the name should be updated

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update route start or end location

column2: Given a user has a non-published route that includes a start location
When the user removes its current start location
Then the route should be updated to start at the first scheduled stop
And the ETAs are recalculated
And no stops are removed from the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update route start or end time

column2: Given a user has a non-published route
When the user updates the route start time
Then the route should be updated with the new start time
And the stop ETAs are recalculated
And no stops are removed from the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update vehicle capacity

column2: Given a user has a non-published route
When the user updates the vehicle capacity
Then the route capacity should be updated
And the route capacity utilization should be updated
And no stops are removed from the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Cannot update route constraints for published routes

column2: Given a user has a dispatched route
When the user attempts to update the route constraints
Then the user should be blocked
And informed that editing published routes is not allowed",Active

column1: 133116,User can move routes to another date,2024-03-26T21:48:54.809Z,Modifying Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Move non published route to another date

column2: Given a user has a non published route
When they attempt to move the route to another date
Then the route should be moved to that date

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Moving routes with order delivery dates to another day

column2: Given a route exists with orders containing delivery date
When the dispatchers moves the route to another day
Then the delivery date for the orders within the route are not updated",Active

column1: 828282,User can schedule a new order to an existing route and respect optimization preferences,2024-11-01T20:23:25.388Z,Modifying Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can schedule an order to a route and respect flexible start time preference
Given the flexible start time setting is enabled
When user schedules an order to a route
Then the route should still start at an optimal time that minimizes idle time
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can schedule an order to a route and respect exclude toll road preference
Given the exclude tool road setting is disabled
When user schedules an order to a route
Then the route should not be routed through a toll road
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can schedule an order to a route and respect exclude ferry preference
Given the exclude ferry setting is disabled
When user schedules an order to a route
Then the route should be routed through a ferry route",Draft
