995295,User can move stops within a route,2025-02-07T19:52:08.763Z,Modifying Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move stop to another position in in the same route
Given a stop is not the current stop
When a dispatcher drags the stop via the RDP to another position
Then the stop sequence is updated
And the ETAs for each stop and order are updated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher can't move stop with re-attempt within route

column2: Given a stop contains the re-attempt for an order
When the dispatcher moves that stop within the route
Then the move is rejected And the user is given appropiate feedback",Draft

column1: 995296,User can move stops to another route,2025-02-07T19:52:21.817Z,Modifying Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move stop to a different route
Given a stop is not the current stop
When a dispatcher moves the stop to a different route
Then the stop is rescheduled to the target route
And the ETAs and polylines for both the routes are updated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher can't move stop with re-attempt to another route

column2: Given a stop contains the re-attempt for an order
When the dispatcher moves that stop to a different route
Then the move is rejected And the user is given appropiate feedback",Draft

column1: 995297,User can unschedule a stop from a route,2025-02-07T19:52:49.586Z,Modifying Routes,,Draft

983011,User can change the route sequence by drawing their preferred route on map,2025-02-01T00:08:17.326Z,Modifying Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can change the route sequence by drawing their preferred route on map

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route
When the user edits the route through the draw route feature
Then routific will generate a route that matches as closely as possible to the pattern drawn by the user

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Draw route feature can violate time window constraints

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route respecting time windows on the orders
When the user edits the route through draw route feature in a manner that violates time windows on the orders
Then routific should generate a route respecting user's drawn pattern by violating time window constraints if needed

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Draw route feature can violate shift end constraint

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route respecting shift time constraints
When the user edits the route through draw route feature in a manner that violates the specified shift duration
Then routific should generate a route respecting user's drawn pattern by violating shift end time if needed

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Draw route feature can violate capacity constraints

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route respecting capacity constraints
When the user adds additional orders to the route that pushes the route to become overcapacitated
And when the user edits the route through draw route feature
Then routific should generate a route respecting user's drawn pattern even though the capacity constraint on the route is violated",Draft

column1: 828279,User can move stop within a route respecting optimization preferences,2024-11-01T20:21:01.099Z,Respect optimization preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move a stop within route and respect flexible start time preference
Given the flexible start time setting is enabled
When user moves a stop within the timeline or a route
Then the route should start at an optimal time that minimizes idle time
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move a stop within route and respect exclude toll road preference
Given the exclude tool road setting is disabled
When user moves a stop within the timeline or a route
Then the route should not be routed through a toll road
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move a stop within route and respect exclude ferry preference
Given the exclude ferry setting is disabled
When user moves a stop within the timeline or a route
Then the route should be routed through a ferry route",Draft

828280,User can move a stop between routes respecting optimization preferences,2024-11-01T20:21:22.588Z,Respect optimization preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move a stop between route and respect flexible start time preference
Given the flexible start time setting is enabled
When user moves a stop between routes
Then both routes should start at an optimal time that minimizes idle time
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move a stop between routes and respect exclude toll road preference
Given the exclude tool road setting is disabled
When user moves a stop between routes
Then both routes should not be routed through a toll road
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move a stop between routes and respect exclude ferry preference
Given the exclude ferry setting is disabled
When user moves a stop between routes
Then both routes should be routed through a ferry route",Draft

828281,User can unschedule a stop from a route respecting optimization preferences,2024-11-01T20:21:49.103Z,Respect optimization preferences,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can unschedule a stop from a route and respect flexible start time preference
Given the flexible start time setting is enabled
When user unschedules a stop from a route
Then the route should still start at an optimal time that minimizes idle time
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can unschedule from stop from a route and respect exclude toll road preference

When user unschedules a stop from a route
Then the route should not be routed through a toll road
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can unschedule a stop from a route and respect exclude ferry preference

91,User can select and delete multiple routes at once,2024-01-31T03:06:05.036Z,Deleting Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can select and delete multiple routes at once as long as they aren't published
Given a mix of empty routes and/or routes with orders scheduled which have not been published
When a user selects those routes
And deletes them
Then the route card should show an interim state to signify it is being removed
And the route should be removed from the route list and timeline after the deletion completes
And any scheduled stops to the route(s) should be unscheduled and available to re-schedule
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User cannot delete a multi-selection that contains published routes
Given some selected routes that include at least one published route
When a user views the actions available to take on that selection of routes
Then the delete action should be disabled
And a tooltip should explain that published routes cannot be deleted",Draft

789384,Invite driver from modal,2024-10-24T19:26:44.831Z,Assigning Drivers,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">  Scenario: Dispatcher invites a driver from the assign driver popup
Given the dispatcher is viewing the assign driver popup
When the dispatcher clicks on ""Invite driver""
Then the system navigates to the drivers page
And the invite driver modal automatically opens",Draft

1009627,User can see list of drivers ordered by familiarity,2025-02-14T20:21:11.777Z,Assigning Drivers,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
Given the organization has previously executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a sorted list of drivers based on their familiarity of the route
Scenario: New Organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
Given the organization does not have any previous executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to a route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a list of drivers sorted alphabetically
Scenario: Familiarity service is unavailable
Given the organization has previously executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is opted into the driver familiarity feature
And that the familiarity service is temporarily unavailable
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to a route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a list of drivers displayed in alphabetical order
Scenario: Any Organization not opted into driver familiarity feature
Given the organization has previously executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is not opted into driver familiarity feature
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to a route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a list of drivers sorted alphabetically
",Draft

1017819,User can see how familiar drivers are with a route,2025-02-20T16:43:07.588Z,Assigning Drivers,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Familiarity column is displayed with a progress bar
Given the organization is opted into driver familiarity
And a new familiarity column has been added to AssignDriverPopover
When the dispatcher opens the AssignDriverPopover
Then each driver’s familiarity score is visibly represented by a segmented progress bar
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher sees driver familiarity in a sorted list
Given the organization is opted into driver familiarity
And there are multiple drivers with varying familiarity scores for the route
When the dispatcher clicks the ""Assign Driver"" option for a route
Then the dispatcher should see the list of drivers sorted by descending familiarity according to the progress bar bucket
And if 2 drivers have the same bucket, they are sorted by familiarity score in descending order
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful Data Population for an Organization

column2: Given the organization ""Fresh Picks"" is opted into driver familiarity
And Fresh Picks has drivers who completed stops within the last year
When we run the script to query the production replica for Fresh Picks
And push the resulting data to the Driver Familiarity Service
Then the service stores all relevant lat/lng data for Fresh Picks drivers
And the dispatcher sees updated familiarity scores in the AssignDriverPopover",Draft

99,User can publish a single route,2024-01-31T03:06:05.050Z,Publishing Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher publishes a single route that does not fire any Customer Notification (CN)
Given an organization that has CN enabled
and this organization uses EMAIL as the delivery method
And a route with valid orders
But the orders do not contain any contact info (email)
When the user publishes the single route
Then the notification summary is displayed
And the summary has no reachable customers
And the publishing summary header informs that only 1 routes is being affected
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher publishes a single route that includes orders with contact info
Given an organization that has CN enabled
and this organization uses EMAIL as the delivery method
And a route with valid orders
And some orders include the contact info (EMAIL)
When the user publishes this route
Then the notification summary is displayed
And the summary informs the number of notifications that will be fired
And the publishing summary header informs that only 1 routes is being affected
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher publishes a single route and CN are disabled
Given an organization that has CN disabled
And a route with valid orders
And some orders include the contact info (EMAIL)
When the user publishes this route
Then the notification summary is displayed
And the summary informs CN is disabled and no notifications will be fired
And the publishing summary header informs that only 1 routes is being affected",Draft

107,User can publish changes made to previously published routes,2024-01-31T03:06:05.064Z,Publishing Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher cannot make changes to a route once completed

column2: Given there are no pending change on a dispatched route
And all stops on the dispatched route have a ""departed"" log status
When the dispatcher attempts to add new orders to the route
Then the dispatcher should be blocked from performing any modifications to the completed route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher can publish already pending changes to route once completed

column2: Given there are pending changes to be published on a dispatched route
And all stops on the dispatched route have a ""departed"" log status
When the dispatcher attempts to publish the changes to a completed routes
Then the system should publish the changes for the route
And the ""driver app"" UI should move the route to the current routes tab

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher removes staged orders from a finished route

column2: Given there are pending changes to be published on a dispatched route
And all stops on the dispatched route have a ""departed"" log status

Then the ""dispatcher app"" UI should show the progress bar on the route card as full
And a check-mark on the progress bar",Draft

column1: 558020,User can see the completion status of a route,2024-08-15T14:37:24.779Z,Publishing Routes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver provides a departed status on a stop on the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: The route has been marked as finished

column2: Given The system updates the route as finished
When all stops on the route have a ""departed"" log status
Then the ""dispatcher app"" UI should show the progress bar on the route card as full
And a check-mark on the progress bar

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: The route has been marked as finished

column2: Given The system updates the route as finished
When all stops on the route have a ""departed"" log status
Then the ""driver app"" UI should move the route to the history tab ",Draft

column1: 1794137,View customers and their details,2026-01-08T21:20:49.468Z,Customer Management,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: No customers exist for the org

column1: 1835080,Add order from customer profile,2026-01-17T00:26:59.025Z,Customer Management,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Quick create order from customer table

column1: 116,User can invite a new user to their org as a driver,2024-01-31T03:06:05.081Z,Driver Management,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Send driver invite to an email that does not have a Routific account

column1: 117,User can grant an existing user in their org a driver role,2024-01-31T03:06:05.082Z,Driver Management,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Showing existing users in org when adding drivers when a user in your org has an undefined email

917503,User can see when a customer won’t get an SMS because the phone number on an order is a landline,2024-12-18T20:00:16.600Z,Customer Notification Settings,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User is adding or editing an order via form

909309,User can optimize routes with time of day predicted traffic,2024-12-16T18:32:43.938Z,Workspace Management,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: ""Schedule All"" assigns unserved orders to existing routes
Given there are unserved orders in the ""unscheduled orders"" tray
And existing routes are available for scheduling
When the user triggers ""Schedule All""
Then the system schedules the unserved orders into the existing routes
And the routes' schedules are updated to reflect the newly assigned orders
And the ""unscheduled orders"" tray is updated to remove the scheduled orders
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reoptimizing routes
Given routes have assigned stops and orders
And the user requests to reoptimize the routes
When the system reoptimizes the routes
Then we recalculate the stop sequence for all routes
And the routes are updated to reflect the optimized schedules
And the system ensures improved efficiency of the routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Moving stops triggers compute-schedule on the route losing stops, and best-insert on the route adding stops
Given Route A has assigned stops
And stops need to be moved to Route B
When the stops are moved from Route A to Route B
Then the system triggers compute-schedule for Route A and best-insert for Route B
And Route B reflects the newly assigned stops
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unscheduling an order removes it from the route
Given Route A has orders assigned
And an order is scheduled for removal
When the order is unscheduled from Route A
Then the system removes the order from Route A
And the system updates the route schedule
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Moving an order updates the route sequence
Given Route A has multiple stops with orders
And an order needs to change its position in the route
When the order is moved to a new position within Route A
Then the system updates the sequence of stops in Route A
And the updated route schedule is returned
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reversing a route updates the stop order
Given Route A has stops in a specific sequence
And the user requests to reverse the route
When the system reverses the route
Then the stops in Route A appear in reverse order
And the system updates the schedule to reflect the reversed sequence",Draft

12241,User can create an organization,2024-02-13T02:50:03.895Z,Organization Management,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Creating a New Company
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user enters valid company creation details
And completes the user creation step
Then a new company should be created
And a Stripe customer should be created for the company
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Require Company Name
Given the user is on the signup page
And has not entered a company name
When the user tries to proceed
Then the user should be blocked from proceeding
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Preventing Organization Creation with Name Containing Weblink
Given the user is on the organization creation page
When the user enters ""<organizationName>"" as the organization name
And attempts to create the organization
Then the creation should be rejected
And a message indicating invalid organization name should be displayed
Examples:
| organizationName                 |
| MyCompany http://mywebsite.com   |
| ExampleOrg www.example.org       |
| TechCo https://tech.example.net  |
| BusinessInc ftp://files.business |
| Store1234 www.store.shop         |
| Store1234 store.shop |
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Rejecting Company Names with Non-Visible Characters Forming a URL
Given the user is on the company creation form
When the user enters a ""<company name>"" with non-visible characters mimicking a URL format
Then the system should identify the company name as invalid
And the form cannot be submitted
And message indicating invalid organization name should be d displayed
Examples:
| badlink.­com | //Copy paste this example, it has a non printable character in it
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Company website is optional

column2: Given the user is on the signup page
And has not provided a company website
When the user tries to proceed
Then they should not be blocked

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Preventing Company Creation with Invalid Website URL
Given the user is on the company creation page
When the user enters ""<invalidURL>"" as the website URL
And attempts to create the company
Then the form cannot be submitted
And user is instructed to enter a valid URL
Examples:
| invalidURL           |
| http://invalid.tld   |
| www.nosuchdomain.xyz |
| http://.com          |
| ftp://invalid.com    |
| justtextwithoutdot |
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Tracking Company Created Event

column2: Given a user is in the company creation flow
When the user succesfully creates a company
Then a 'Company Created' event should be tracked
And a company profile should be created with the relevant company information

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Editing company name as admin
Given the user is on the company settings page
And the user has admin permissions
When the user updates the company name to ""New name""
Then the change should be saved
And a success message should be shown
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Company name edit triggers analytics event
Given the user successfully updates the company name
Then a ""Company name updated"" analytics event should be fired
And it should include previous and new values
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher and read only users cannot edit company name
Given the user does not have admin permissions
Then the company name input should be read-only",Draft
151573,Send Invite,2024-04-16T16:03:42.935Z,Managing Teammates,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invite users to an org
Given a user is an admin in an org
When they invite a teammate with one or more roles
Then an invite is created with those roles
And an invite email is sent if if the user does not yet have a Routific account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatchers cannot invite drivers
Given a user is a dispatcher but not an admin in an org
When the dispatcher attempts to invite a driver
Then the action is blocked
And the dispatcher sees feedback to ask their admin for invite privileges
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invite teammate with optional Name in the member invite

column2: Given the user has necessary permisson to invite teammates
And includes a Name in the invite
And assigned an available role
When user sends the teammate invitation
Then the invite email received by the employee is personalized using the provided name

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block invite if teammate already exists.

column2: Given the user has necessary permisson to invite teammates
And inputs the email of an existing teammate.
When user submits the invite
Then they are blocked and given feedback that the teammate already exists in the org

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Revoke a pending invite
Given an invite is pending
And the user has an admin role
When they revoke the invite
Then the invite is marked revoked
And the invite cannot be accepted
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invites expire after 30 days
Given an invite is pending
When 30 days pass from the creation of the invite
Then the invite is marked expired
And the invite cannot be accepted",Draft
151574,Accept Invite,2024-04-16T16:06:10.219Z,Managing Teammates,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful attempt using email & password

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And input a name, valid email and acceptable password
When they submit the form
Then a routific account is created using the name, email
And the user added to the org that sent the invite
And the user is assigned the role specified in the invite
And the pending status for the corresponding invite is updated in the invite table

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful attempt using Google SSO

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And chose to continue with Google
When they successfully authenticate with Google SSO
Then a routific account is created using the name and email returned by Google
And the user added to the org that sent the invite
And the user is assigned the role specified in the invite
And the pending status for the corresponding invite is updated in the invite table

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful attempt using Apple SSO

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And chose to continue with Apple
When they successfully authenticate with Apple account
Then a routific account is created using the name and email returned by Apple
And the user added to the org that sent the invite
And the user is assigned the role specified in the invite
And the pending status for the corresponding invite is updated in the invite table

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unsuccessful attempt for existing accounts

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And uses an email that already has an existing routific account
When they try to sign up and accept invite
Then they are blocked and shown feedeback that the account already exists

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unsuccessful attempt using an already used invite link

column2: Given the corresponding invite has already been accepted
When the user opens an used invite link
Then they can not use the link to accept the invite
And are shown feedback that invite is no longer valid",Draft

column1: 1794135,Invite existing users to an organization,2026-01-07T23:53:01.239Z,Managing Teammates,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin invites an existing user to their organization
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is an existing Routific user with a different org
When the admin invites that user by email with one or more roles
Then an invite is created with those roles
And no invite email is sent to the user
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin cannot invite a user already in their organization
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is a user who is already a member of that org
When the admin attempts to invite that user by email
Then the invite is rejected
And an error message indicates the user is already a member
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin cannot invite a deleted user
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is a deleted user account
When the admin attempts to invite that deleted user by email
Then the invite is rejected
And an error message indicates the user cannot be invited
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing user sees pending invite on web app account settings
Given an existing user has a pending invite to join another org
And the user logs in
Then they see an notification about a pending invite
And when the user navigates to account settings on the web app
Then they see the pending invite with org details and assigned roles
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing driver sees pending invite on mobile app
Given an existing driver user has a pending invite to join another org
When the driver views the company page on the mobile app
Then they see the pending invite with org details
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing user accepts invite and is moved to new org
Given an existing user has a pending invite to join another org
When the user accepts the invite
Then the user is moved to the inviting org
And the user's roles are replaced with the invited roles
And the user is disconnected from any prior driver profiles
And an audit trail entry is created
And the user is logged out
When the user logs back in
Then the user will be in the new org
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User with pending invite can sign up without using invite link
Given a pending invite exists for an email address
And no Routific account exists for that email
When someone signs up with that email without using the invite link
Then the sign-up is allowed
And a new account is created
And the pending invite remains available for them to accept later",Draft

1794136,Invite existing drivers using the unified user invite flow,2026-01-08T00:13:29.546Z,Managing Teammates,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin invites an existing driver from another org with driver role
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is an existing driver in a different org
When the admin invites that driver by email with the driver role
Then an invite is created with the driver role
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing driver sees pending invite on mobile app company page
Given an existing driver has a pending invite to join another org
When the driver views the company page on the mobile app
Then they see the pending invite with org details and assigned roles
When the driver accepts the invite
Then the driver is moved to the inviting org
And a new driver profile is created for the inviting org
And the driver is disconnected from their prior driver profile
And the driver no longer has access to routes from the previous org",Draft

143366,Optimization is blocked after user usage limit is exceeded,2024-04-09T20:05:32.042Z,Optimizing Routes (/optimize endpoint),"

Trigger a request to the /optimize/create endpoint, you may use the attached payload.

 

The request should succeed (considering the user usage is untouched)

Trigger a follow-up request with a different set of stops. The previous payload had 100 stops, therefore, the second payload should exceed the user usage limits.

The request should fail with a usage limit error and status code 403.

Be aware that updating usage limits is an async and not guaranteed operation, therefore, you may face some flakiness. You may try to do some additional requests and also check user usage if the tests fail.

",Draft

933880,Optimization read don't show routeSchedule if rate limiter is reached,2024-12-20T00:09:54.867Z,Optimizing Routes (/optimize endpoint),"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Rate limiter blocks a request when exceeding the limit
Given the RateLimiter service is configured with a limit of 4 requests per 60 seconds
And the user has made 4 requests for the same action_uuid in the last 60 seconds
When the user makes another GET /optimize API call with the action_uuid
Then the RateLimiter service increments the count for the action_uuid
And the RateLimiter response indicates the request is not allowed
And the API returns a 429 Too Many Requests error
And the error response body includes a message like: { ""msg"": ""Failed to poll for {action_uuid} solution, the limit of requests per minute was reached. You could try again in X seconds."" }",Draft

86011,Routician can view company's billing info,2024-03-05T20:24:42.013Z,Debugging User's Organizations,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routicians can view company in Stripe

column1: 977,Routician can create new user under a new company,2024-02-07T15:43:56.206Z,Create User,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routician can create a new user and company

Then a new company is created
And a new user is created under that company
And the user is assigned a dispatcher role",Draft

55293,Routician can create a new user under an existing company,2024-02-22T00:07:04.706Z,Create User,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routician can create a new user under an existing company
When a Routician creates a user using the /admin/user/create endpoint
Then a user is created under the specified company with the specified role
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routician can create a user that was invited to a company
Given a user has been invited to a company
When a Routician manual creates the invited user account using the /admin/user/create endpoint
And has set `manualInvite` to true
Then a user is created under the specified company with the specified role
And an email is sent to the created user confirming their account creation
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invited user receives notification email of account creation

column2: Given a user has been invited to join an existing org
And a Routician has received the notification to manually create the invited user account
When a Routician creates a user account for an invited user
Then the invited user should receive an email confirming an account has been created
And the name of the sender of the email should be 'Routific'
",Draft

946,User can view usage and cycle date range,2024-02-06T21:20:36.144Z,Billing,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: A user can view free trial for their new company
When a new company is created
Then a user can see the current billing cycle date range of 7 days
And that they are on a free trial
And that they have unlimited orders
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: A user can view scheduled order usage
When a new company is downgraded to the free plan
Then a user can see the current billing cycle date range of 1 month
And how many orders have been scheduled across their company in the current billing cycle
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Free plan billing cycle renews monthly
Given a user is on a free plan
When a user views the billing page after the end of a billing cycle
Then they should see a new billing cycle which starts at the end of the last cycle and ends a month later
And a count of only the orders scheduled in the new billing cycle
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Paid plan billing cycle is in sync with Stripe
Given a user is on a paid plan
And that plan was not cancelled at the time of cycle renewal
When a user views the billing page after the end of a billing cycle
Then they should see a new billing cycle with a date range of that matches their Stripe subscription's cycle
And a count of only the orders scheduled in the new billing cycle
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Billing cycle renews at end of short months
Given a user has a billing cycle which ends on a late day of a month (i.e. Aug 31)
When the billing cycle renews on a shorter month (i.e. Sept)
Then then the end date of that billing cycle is set to the last day of that month (i.e. Sept 30)
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View usage count of past billing cycles
Given a billing cycle with an end date in the past
When an engineer looks up that billing cycle via the DB
Then they can see how many orders were billed to it",Draft
55290,User can view plan,2024-02-21T21:30:39.135Z,Billing,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Trial user can see they are on a growth trial plan
Given an org has no subscription in Stripe
When a user goes to view their billing details
Then they see the org is on a growth trial plan
And they have an option to upgrade
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Trial user on an expired growth trial plan
Given an org has no paid subscription in Stripe
When a user goes to view their billing details
Then they see the org is downgraded to a free plan
And they have an option to upgrade
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Free user can see they are on a free plan
Given an org has no subscription in Stripe
When a user goes to view their billing details
Then they see the org is on a free plan
And they have an option to upgrade
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Paid user can see they are on the growth plan
Given an org has a subscription in Stripe
When a user goes to view their billing details
Then they see they are on the Growth plan
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Users on an expired paid plan
When a user goes to view their billing details
Then they see they are on a free plan",Draft
55291,User can upgrade plan,2024-02-21T21:30:48.013Z,Billing,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Free user can upgrade to Growth plan
Given an org is on the Free plan
When a user initiates an upgrade
And confirms payment with valid payment details
Then they get a notification of a successful subscription
And they see the org is now on the Growth plan
And the billing cycle resets to the current day
And the usage is 0
And they get an email with a payment receipt
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can pay for a subscription with a credit card
When a user initiates an upgrade
And confirms payment with a valid credit card
Then their subscription to the Growth plan is activated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can pay for a subscription with Google Pay
When a user initiates an upgrade
And successfully confirms payment thorugh the Google Pay option
Then their subscription to the Growth plan is activated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can pay for a subscription with Link
When a user initiates an upgrade
And successfully confirms payment thorugh the Link option
Then their subscription to the Growth plan is activated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Abandoning upgrade process does not change plan
Given an org is on the Free plan
When a user initiates an upgrade
And does not confirm payment with valid payment details
Then the user remains on the Free plan
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User gets receipt upon upgrade
When a user successfully subscribes an org to the Growth plan
Then a receipt is emailed to the org's billing email
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Subscription created event is tracked
Given a company is on the free plan
When a user upgrades the company to the Growth plan
Then a Routician can see a subscription created event in Mixpanel
And in Gleap
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Plan name of a user is shared with analytics tools
When a user upgrades to a growth plan
Then a Routician can see that user is on a Growth plan in Gleap
And in Mixpanel",Active

55294,Subscribers are charged automatically on renewal,2024-02-22T17:01:05.618Z,Billing,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: A subscribed org automatically gets billed at the start of each billing cycle.
Given an org is subscribed to a paid plan
When the billing cycle renews
Then their payment method on file is automatically charged a flat fee for the new cycle
And any additional usage from the previous cycle
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User gets receipt upon successful renewal payment
Given an org is subscribed to a paid plan
When the billing cycle renews
And the payment on file is successfully charged
Then a receipt is emailed to the org's billing email",Draft

271403,User subscription can be cancelled,2024-05-13T20:03:16.386Z,Billing,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routician can end a subscription with immediate effect

column2: Given Routician has permissions rights in stripe to cancel user subscriptions
When Routician cancels a subscription for a paid account with immediate effect
Then the subscription status for the account in Routific shows as enrolled in free plan

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can continue to schedule orders after the subscription terminates under the free plan

column2: Given an account's subscription has been terminated
When a user schedules less than 100 orders
Then user should see an optimized solution

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Tracking churn event

column2: When Stripe terminates the subscription for an organization
And Routific processes the subscription event and generates analytics event to Segment
Then a Routician should be able to track ""Subscription Churned"" event which contains additional metadata related to billing plan

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View explanation for upcoming cancellation
Given the companies subscription will get cancelled at the end of the current billing cycle
When a user visits the billing page
Then they are shown a warning banner indicating the date when subscription cancellation takes effect.
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Receive confirmation email after cancelling subscription

column3: Given a user completes subscription cancellation via the Stripe billing portalWhen the cancellation webhook is received with cancel_at_period_end = true
Then the user is sent an email confirming the cancellation from Routific",Draft

column1: 1350672,New user gets a 7 day trial,2025-07-15T18:31:34.798Z,Billing,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Company has a 7 day trial after signup
Given a company was created within 7 days
When a user views the routing or billing page
Then they see how many days remain in their free trial
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Company is downgraded to free plan after trial
Given a company was created more than 7 days ago
And does not have an active subscription
When the trial expires after 7 days
Then the company is downgraded to a free plan
And a user can see that they are on the free plan on the billing page
And they can see their remaining order count on the routing page",Draft

102398,User can contact support,2024-03-14T22:01:34.585Z,Support,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Anonymous user requests help via the help button
Given the user is unauthenticated
And   is on the login or signup page
When  the user presses the help button
Then  the Gleap widget should appear
And   the user can send a message
And the message should be visible to the support team in Gleap
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Anonymous user requests help after a login error
Given the user is unauthenticated
When  the user attempts to login with invalid credentials
And   the user receives an error with an option to contact support
And   the user clicks the 'contact support' option
Then  the Gleap widget should appear
And   the user can send a message
And the message should be visible to the support team in Gleap
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Authenticated user requests help
Given the user is authenticated
When  the user clicks the 'contact support' option
Then  the Gleap widget should appear
And   the user can view previous messages
And   the user can send a new message
And   the new message should be visible to the support team in Gleap and associated with the current user
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Chat information is not available after user logout
Given the user is authenticated and has sent messages via the Gleap widget
When  the user logs out
Then the user's chat information should not be available or visible
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User does not see any messages after logging out and identity reset
Given the user is authenticated and has sent messages via the Gleap widget
When  the user logs out
Then the user should not see any previous messages if they access the Gleap widget again",Draft

1009628,Maintenance page is visible to users when v3 is under scheduled maintenance,2025-02-14T21:07:33.531Z,Maintenance,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routician can access the maintenance page url

column2: Given that the maintenance page is deployed but not promoted
When a Routician access the maintenance page url
Then a static page will be rendered with a message that Routific is undergoing maintenance with a link to the status page

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">
Scenario: Routician can divert all traffic to the maintenance page

column2: Given that the Routician has configured all traffic to be diverted to the maintenance page
When a user navigates to v3 dispatcher app page
Or is logged into the v3 dispatcher app and navigates to different page in-app
Then a static page will be rendered with a message that Routific is undergoing maintenance ",Draft

column1: 740246,View insights for a date range,2024-10-15T23:26:33.417Z,View Insights,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View insights for the default/fallback date range
Given the user has not previously set a date range on the insights page
When user opens the insights page
Then the date range defaults to the start and end dates of the last calendar month
And the user is shown corresponding metrics for routes, orders, distance, and working time aggregated across the entire organization
And the trendline renders data points for the default date range
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View insights for the last set date range
Given the user has previously set a date range on the insights page
When user opens the insights page
Then their previous selection is reflected in the date range
And the user is shown corresponding metrics for routes, orders, distance, and working time aggregated across the entire organization
And the trendline renders data points for the previously set date range
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View insights in preferred distance unit
Given the user is on the Insights page
And the company settings have a preferred unit for mileage/distance
When the distance metrics are displayed
Then the total distance is in the preferred unit set in the company settings",Draft

740245,Adjust the date range for insights analysis,2024-10-15T23:26:16.724Z,View Insights,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View insights for range of 31 days or less
Given the user navigates to the insights page
And selects a date range of 31 days or less
When the user submits the date range
Then their date range selection is remembered for the future
And the metrics and data in the chart update to reflect the selected date range
And the trendline renders daily data points on the graph
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View insights for range greater than 31 days and upto than 6 months
Given the user navigates to the insights page
And selects a date range greater than 31 days and up to 6 months
When the user submits the date range
Then their date range selection is remembered for the future
And the metrics and data in the chart update to reflect the selected date range
And the trendline renders weekly data points on the graph
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View insights for a date range greater than 6 months upto 12 months
Given the user navigates to the insights page
And selects a date range greater than 6 months and upto 12 months
When the user submits the date range
Then their date range selection is remembered for the future
And the metrics and data in the chart update to reflect the selected date range
And the trendline should render monthly data points on the graph
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Attempt to view insights for a date range longer than 12 months

column3: Given the user is on the insights page
When  the selected date range is longer than 12 months
Then the user is blocked from submitting the date range
And given feedback to pick a smaller date range",Draft

789381,Incomplete week/month tooltip on insights graph doesn't always render,2024-10-24T16:11:15.152Z,View Insights,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Complete first week - Complete last week

And the end date is Sunday, October 13

And the start date is Monday, May 6
And the end date is Wednesday, October 16

And the start date is Wednesday, May 22
And the end date is Sunday, October 13

And the start date is Tuesday, May 7
And the end date is Wednesday, October 16
When the graph is displayed
Then an ""incomplete week"" tag is shown for the first data point
And an ""incomplete week"" tag is shown for the last data point
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Complete first month - Complete last month
Given the start date and end date are more than 6 months apart
And the start date is January 1
And the end date is October 31
When the graph is displayed
Then no ""incomplete month"" tags are shown
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Incomplete first month - Complete last month

And the start date is January 2
And the end date is October 31
When the graph is displayed
Then an ""incomplete month"" tag is shown for the first data point
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Complete first month - Incomplete last month
Given the start date and end date are more than 6 months apart
And the start date is January 1
And the end date is October 30
When the graph is displayed
Then an ""incomplete month"" tag is shown for the last data point
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Incomplete first month - Incomplete last month
Given the start date and end date are more than 6 months apart
And the start date is January 2
And the end date is October 30
When the graph is displayed

846707,Reflect the selected date range in the  insights page URL,2024-11-18T21:10:36.416Z,View Insights,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Attempt to open insights page with No Start and End dates in the URL.

column2: When the user accesses the insights page
And both `startDate` and `endDate` are not provided in the URL
Then the URL is updated to include both last month's start and end date
And the insights page displays the results based on this date range.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Attempt to open insights page with Invalid Start or End date Params in the URL.

column2: When the user accesses the insights page
And either `startDate` and `endDate` is not a valid date
Then the URL is updated to include last month's start and end date
And the insights page displays the results based on this date range.

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Complete URL is provided.

column2: When the user accesses the insights page
And both `startDate` and `endDate` are correctly provided in the URL
Then the insights page displays the results based on the provided date range.",Draft

column1: 864267,View driver breakdown details for a selected metric,2024-11-28T20:42:13.216Z,View Details By Driver,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View driver-level insights

column2: Given the user is on the insights page
When the user selects a metric
Then the page shows that metric broken down by driver
And the default chart type is ""bar""
And the data respects the selected date range
And the data respects the company's setting for KM or MI

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View data as a bar chart
When the user views the driver level breakdown for any given metric
And the chart type is set to ""bar""
Then the page shows the total value per driver in bar chart format
And the bar chart is sorted by value in descending order
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Get bar chart details on hover

column2: Given the user is viewing the driver level breakdown for any given metric
And the chart type is set to ""bar""
When the user hovers over a row in the bar chart
Then a tooltip appears showing the total value for the hovered driver

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can toggle between chart types

column2: Given the user is viewing the driver level breakdown for any given metric
When the user toggles the chart type to ""line""
Then the page displays the data in line chart + table format
When the user toggles the chart type to ""bar""
Then the page displays the data in bar chart format

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View data as a line chart + table

column2: Given the user is viewing the driver level breakdown for any given metric
And the chart type is set to ""line""
Then the page shows the trend over time per driver in line chart format
And the page shows the total value and trend over time per driver in table format
And the table is sorted by driver name in ascending order

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Get line chart details on hover

column2: Given the user is viewing the driver level breakdown for any given metric
And the chart type is set to ""line""
When the user hovers over the line chart
Then a tooltip appears showing the value per driver for the hovered date or date range
And the tooltip data is sorted by value in descending order

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Sort the table in ascending order

column2: Given the user is viewing the driver level breakdown for any given metric
When the user clicks on the header of any column of the table
Then the whole table is sorted by the values of the clicked column in ascending order
And clicking on the column again sorts the table by the values of the clicked column in descending order
And clicking on the column again removes sorting on the table",Draft

column1: 876551,Export driver breakdown details for selected metric,2024-12-02T17:15:46.808Z,View Details By Driver,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Export button is not visible on the insights page header

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Exporting metric data with current sorting and filtering

888834,Filter driver breakdown details for a selected metric,2024-12-10T17:47:53.953Z,View Details By Driver,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View driver-level insights when 'some' drivers are selected

column1: 143371,See and accept invitation to join a company on mobile,2024-04-09T21:10:15.512Z,Join a company,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: See invite to join another company

832377,Navigate to stop,2024-11-04T19:28:43.224Z,Navigate to Stop,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Navigate to stop using Google Maps
Given a user has Google Maps installed
And a route assigned to them
And a stop on that route with a location where only an address was provided (not coordinates)
When the user views the stop in the mobile app
And clicks on the navigate button
Then they can choose Google Maps
And Google Maps will open directions to the address from the current location
And the address string in Google maps will show the specific street address provided for the order
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Navigate to stop using Waze Maps
Given a user has Waze Maps installed
And a route assigned to them
When the user views the stop in the mobile app
And clicks on the navigate button
Then they can choose Waze Maps
And Waze Maps will open directions to the address from the current location
And Waze will not show the address string provided for the order
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Navigate to stop with user-provided coordinates
Given a user is assigned a route that has a stop with coordinates provided by the dispatcher
When the user views that stop in the mobile app
And clicks on the navigate button
And chooses Google Maps
Google Maps will open directions to the provided coordinates from the current location
And the user may not see a matching address to what is displayed in Routific",Active
993247,Driver can complete orders,2025-02-06T21:44:04.631Z,Complete orders,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can mark orders as delivered
Given an incomplete order on the current stop
When a driver marks an order as delivered
Then the dispatcher can see the delivered status of this order
And the time of delivery is updated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can mark orders as failed
Given an incomplete order on the current stop
When a driver marks an order as failed
Then the driver is prompted to provide a reason
And dispatcher can see the missed status of this order
And the reason provided
And the time of delivery attempt is updated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can communicate intent to re-attempt an order
Given an incomplete order at the current stop
When the driver chooses the reattempt option
Then the attempt is recorded as missed with the reason ""Reattempt planned""
And the dispatcher sees that the order has a reattempt planned
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can complete re-attempt for order

column2: Given an incomplete re-attempt of an order at the current stop
When the driver views the order
Then the driver can choose to complete the attempt as usual or mark it for re-attempt again

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver familiarity score is updated after orders completed
Given the driver has no prior familiarity score
When a driver marks an order as completed
Then the driver's familiarity score for a new route is updated to show a value",Active
1032151,Driver can  reattempt orders,2025-02-28T20:24:37.515Z,Complete orders,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver spawns re-attempt with internet
When the driver chooses the re-attempt option for an order at their current stop
Then a new stop is created in that route for re-attempting the same order
And the stop is scheduled at least 30 minutes after the re-attempt was initiated
And the first attempt is marked missed with reason - ""Re-attempt scheduled""
And any other order at the same stop are unaffected by the re-attempt

Scenario: Driver attempts to spawn re-attempt while offline

Given there is no internet connection 

Then driver is blocked from spawning a re-attempt for an order

",Draft

888835,Arrival time is marked when user gets close to the stop,2024-12-10T18:02:49.165Z,Complete Stops,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Arrival time is marked when user gets close to the stop
Given a driver has a GPS available
When they move within 100m of the current stop's location
Then the stop will get marked arrived automatically",Draft

888836,Stop is completed automatically if all orders are completed,2024-12-10T18:03:21.722Z,Complete Stops,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Stop is completed automatically if all orders are completed
Given a driver has marked all orders at a stop as delivered or missed
And they have not marked the stop as completed
When they move over 100m away from the stop location
Then the stop will get marked completed automatically",Draft

888837,Stop is not completed automatically with incomplete orders,2024-12-10T18:03:43.334Z,Complete Stops,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Stop is not completed automatically with incomplete orders
Given a user has arrived at a stop
And they have orders at the stop that are not marked delivered or missed
And they have not marked the stop as completed
When they move over 100m away from the stop location
Then the stop will remain incomplete",Draft

1021914,Attempt an out of sequence stop,2025-02-20T23:26:00.587Z,Complete Stops,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can choose stop to attempt from carousel
Given a route is started
And the selected stop is not completed
And the selected stop is not next in sequence
When the driver marks it as ""current stop"" from the carousel
Then that stop is moved up to be the next in sequence
And the remaining incomplete stops will follow in their original sequence
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can choose stop to attempt from list view
Given a route is started
And the selected stop is not completed
And the selected stop is not next in sequence
When the driver marks it as ""current stop"" in list view
Then that stop is moved up to be the next in sequence
And the remaining incomplete stops will follow in their original sequence
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can only act the current stop
Given a route is started
And the current stop A is active
When another stop B is marked as ""current stop""
Then the stop A can no longer be acted upon
And stop B can be acted upon
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Arrival time is discarded if driver chooses to attempt different stop
Given a driver has entered the vicinity of their next stop
And the arrival time has been captured
When the driver marks a different stop to attempt next
Then the arrival time for the original stop will be discarded
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver can attempt next stop while offline
Given the driver is offline
And they have multiple stops remaining
When they mark a stop as ""attempt next""
Then the stop sequence is updated
But the polylines are not updated
And the ETAs are not updated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Polylines and ETAs update when driver comes back online
Given the driver was offline
And they had marked a different stop to attempt next
When the driver comes back online
Then the polylines are updated to show the new route
And the ETAs are recalculated for the new sequence
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">
Scenario: Driver cannot mark another stop as current if there is an in-progress stop
Given a driver has completed orders at their current stop
And they have not completed thestop
When they try to mark another stop as current
Then they receive an error message
And are prompted to complete their current stop first
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario:  Action a re-attempt stop out of sequence
Given the driver chooses Go to a stop containing a re-attempt out of sequence
Then that stop is marked as the current stop
And the route sequence, eta and polyline is updated accordingly",Draft

Then they can view all the package barcodes associated with that order

column1: ",Draft
1569724,Scan the package barcodes on orders,2025-10-08T14:36:10.283Z,Scan package barcodes,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful package barcode scan

column2: Given the driver has opened the scanning session for an order at their current stop
And the order has associated package barcodes
When the driver scans a barcode that matches one of the packages on the order
Then the system displays a success message confirming the scan
And marks that package as scanned
And the count of scanned packages is updated

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invalid barcode scan

column2: Given the driver has opened the scanning session for an order at their current stop
When the driver scans a barcode that does not belong to the order
Then the system displays an error message clearly indicating the barcode does not match any package on the order

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Viewing scan progress

column2: Given the driver has scanned one or more barcodes in a session
When the driver views the list of packages for the order
Then the system displays which packages have been scanned
And which packages remain unscanned

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Saving scans from a session

column2: Given the driver is in an active scanning session
When the driver saves the session
Then all scanned barcodes are stored and associated with the order

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Canceling a scanning session

column2: Given the driver is in an active scanning session
When the driver chooses to cancel the session
Then the system discards all scans performed in that session
And no scan data is saved to the order

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scanning affordance available for current stop with unscanned packages

column2: Given the driver is viewing an order at their current stop
And there are unscanned packages for the order
When the driver views the order details
Then the scan affordance is available

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scanning affordance available for past stop with unscanned packages

column2: Given the driver is viewing an order at a previously completed stop
And there are unscanned packages for the order
When the driver views the order details
Then the scan affordance is available

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scanning affordance hidden when all packages scanned

column2: Given the driver is viewing an order at their current or a past stop
And all required packages for that order have been successfully scanned
When the driver views the order details
Then the scan affordance is not shown

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scanning affordance hidden for future stops

column2: Given the driver is viewing an order that belongs to a future stop
When the driver views the order details
Then the scan affordance is not shown

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Multiple packages share the same barcode

column2: Given the order contains multiple packages that share the same barcode
And the driver has opened the scanning session for that order
When the driver scans the shared barcode first time
Then the system marks one instance of that package barcode as scanned
And the scanned count and progress update accordingly",Draft

1021915,Assigned a driver to route event is track,2025-02-26T21:53:51.515Z,Tracking Analytics Events,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Tracking Familiarity Score and Rating of a Driver Assigned to a Route

column2: Given an organization is opted into driver familiarity
And that organization has drivers who have completed stops within the last 3 months
When a dispatcher assigns a driver to a route
Then Routific retrieves the driver’s familiarity score based on past route assignments
And Routific retrieves the driver’s ranking comparing to other drivers
And a routician could see the correlation between ranking and picked drivers with a Mixpanel dashboard.",Draft

column1: 220220,Routician can view the health of GPU workers and status of GPU jobs,2024-05-01T18:11:11.472Z,Monitoring,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routician can view the health of GPU workers and status of GPU jobs

column2: Given Routician has access to ""GPU Worker"" dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician chooses a DateTime range
Then Routician can view the following metrics for the specified time range:

column5: - CPU and Memory Utilization for each worker
- Job queue time before it get picked up for processing
- number of GPU jobs running at any given time
- number of panics and errors encountered by the workers

column1: ",Draft

265260,Routician can view the number of scheduling actions that invoked the GA algorithm,2024-05-09T22:33:32.269Z,Monitoring,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Routician can view the number of scheduling actions that invoked the GA algorithm

column2: Given a Routician has access to ""Product Management"" dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician chooses a DateTime range
Then Routician can view the following metrics for the specified time range:

column3: - number of scheduling actions that leveraged GA
- number of scheduling actions that defaulted to LS due to incompatible features
- how often GA is the winning solution
- how does GA solutions compare to LS solutions in terms of self-intersections",Draft

column1: 324626,Routician can track average Engine API request time for each problem size request,2024-05-24T18:20:21.396Z,Monitoring,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Feature: Track average Engine API request time for each problem size request
Scenario: Add num_stops label to engine API requests metrics
Given the Engine API processes a request
When the request is logged
Then it should include a ""num_stops"" label
Scenario: Set up alerting for request duration
Given the alerting rules are configured
When the average request duration exceeds the threshold
Then an alert should be triggered
",Draft

326676,Analytics for HERE as a primary geocoder,2024-06-05T16:14:38.879Z,Geocoder,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Track number of times Google returns the same results as HERE

column2: Given a Routician has access to Geocoder dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician navigates to the Geocoder dashboard
And selects a custom time range
Then a panel exists that displays aggregate number of addresses where Google and HERE have the same result when the Geocoder fallsback to Google due to low quality results from HERE

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Track number low confidence results from Google, when Google is secondary geocoder

column2: Given a Routician has access to Geocoder dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician navigates to the Geocoder dashboard
And selects a custom time range
Then a panel exists that displays total number of low confidence results from Google

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Track number of times Geocoder fallsback to Google

column2: Given a Routician has access to Geocoder dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician navigates to the Geocoder dashboard
And selects a custom time range
Then a panel exists that displays total number of times Geocoder fallsback from HERE to Google

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Track number of times Google results match HERE when HERE returned single low quality result

column2: Given a Routician has access to Geocoder dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician navigates to the Geocoder dashboard
And selects a custom time range
Then a panel exists that displays number of times Google results match HERE when HERE returned single low quality result

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Track number of times Google results matched one of HERE when HERE returned multiple results

column2: Given a Routician has access to Geocoder dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician navigates to the Geocoder dashboard
And selects a custom time range
Then a panel exists that displays number of times Google results matched one of HERE when HERE returned multiple results

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Track how often we return Google geocoded results to the user when HERE is primary geocoder

column2: Given a Routician has access to Geocoder dashboard in Grafana
When a Routician navigates to the Geocoder dashboard
And selects a custom time range
Then a multiple panels exist that render how often Routific returns Google geocoded results when HERE returns no result, single result, and multiple results.",Draft

57342,User encounters an unhandled error,2024-02-24T03:03:45.546Z,General,"

You can manually trigger an error boundary by adding the following to the browser console: store.ui.setVisitForm({ visible: true, visit: 'asdfsd', saving: false });

Scenario: User encounters an unhandled exception
Given the user is logged into the application
When an unhandled exception occurs
Then an error afforance should appear with options to refresh or contact support
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Interacting with the error afforance options
Given the user is presented with the unhandled exception afforance
When the user selects an option (ie. refresh or contact support)
Then system should execute that action",Draft

column1: 1011676,Error when accessing expired or old delivery tracker link,2025-02-18T20:27:51.687Z,Error Handling,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Error due to authentication failure

",Draft

column1: 12282,Driver can start a route,2024-02-13T22:29:57.361Z,V2 Driver App,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Start a route at the right time and location

column2: Given a route was dispatched to the driver
And they have provided necessary location permission
When driver opens the route in the app
Then they can start the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Attempt to start a route far away from start locaiton

column2: Given the driver is attempting to start a route
And driver is far away from the intended start location
When driver atempts to start the route
Then they are warned

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Attempt to start a route at a different time

column2: Given the driver has an in progress route
And current time is far off from the intended start time
When driver atempts to start the route
Then they are warned

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Attempt to start a route with no location permission

column2: Given the driver did not provide location sharing permission
When they attempt to start a route
Then they are asked to privide location permission

column1: ",Draft

184332,User can request synchronous optimization,2024-04-24T15:16:32.139Z,API Integration,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: A synchronous optimization can take up to 60 seconds

And the processing time is within 60 seconds
Then the user recieves a solution response synchronously",Draft

383999,SMS Updated ETA notifications are disabled by default for new accounts,2024-06-18T18:18:15.937Z,Customer Notifications,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: New accounts don't allow updated ETA notification over SMS
Given a new account is created
When Customer Notifications are enabled
And Planned Delivery notifications are enabled
And a Route is dispatched
And a Driver event forces a Updated ETA notification to be fired
Then no Updated ETA notifications will be fired.",Draft
