429039,Email Templates cannot be modified,2024-06-27T19:03:34.409Z,Customer Notifications,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Professional user cannot update any email template

column2: Given a user is on paid professional plan with customer notification
When the user navigates to email notification template
And clicks on ""Edit"" button on any one of the templates
Then the user cannot edit the subject and body field",Draft

column1: 429040,User cannot update business information,2024-06-27T19:04:26.854Z,Customer Notifications,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User on v2 cannot save an url to Business name field

column2: When user navigates to notification settings with email notification enabled
Then the user is blocked from entering a url/email into the business name field

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User on v2 cannot save an url to Business phone number field

column2: When user navigates to notification settings with email notification enabled
Then the user is blocked from entering a url/email into the business phone number field

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User on v2 cannot save an url to Business address field

column2: When user navigates to notification settings with email notification enabled
Then the user is blocked from entering a url/email into the business address field",Draft

column1: 429041,Email templates with url in tags,2024-06-27T19:06:12.170Z,Customer Notifications,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Email template with url in notes should get rejected

column2: Given an order has a url in the notes field
And email notifications are enabled on the user's account with all notification types containing the notes tag
When the order is dispatched
And the order goes through the delivery lifecycle
Then all email notifications for the order with a url in notes are blocked by Routific

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Email template with url in stop_name should get rejected

column2: Given an order has a url in the stop_name field
And email notifications are enabled on the user's account with all notification types containing the stop_name tag
When the order is dispatched
And the order goes through the delivery lifecycle
Then all email notifications for the order with a url in stop_name are blocked by Routific",Draft

column1: 1365002,Try the new Routific,2025-07-16T13:19:11.090Z,Account Management,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: v2 paid user with no v3 account can try v3
Given no v3 account exists for a user's email
And the user has a Stripe subscription which is paid
When the user clicks through ""Try the new Routific""
Then they are logged into v3
And they have dispatcher and admin roles
And their plan in v3 is growth, linked to their v2 Stripe customer
And their v3 account is linked to their v2 account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: v2 shopify user with no v3 account can try v3
Given no v3 account exists for a user's email
And the v2 user is set to paid
But no Stripe subscription exists
When the user clicks through ""Try the new Routific""
Then they are logged into v3
And they have dispatcher and admin roles
And they are on a trial plan in v3
And their v3 account is linked to their v2 account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: v2 user with no subscription can try v3
Given no v3 account exists for a user's email
And the user's v2 subscription is not paid
When the user clicks through ""Try the new Routific""
Then they are logged into v3
And they have dispatcher and admin roles
And they are on a trial plan in v3
And their v3 account is linked to their v2 account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: v2 paid user with existing v3 account can try v3
Given a v3 account exists for a user's email
And their v2 plan is paid
When the user clicks through ""Try the new Routific""
Then they are logged into v3
And they have dispatcher and admin roles
But no read only role
And their plan in v3 is growth, linked to their v2 Stripe customer
And their v3 account is linked to their v2 account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: v2 free user with existing v3 account can try v3
Given a v3 account exists for a user's email
And their v2 plan is not paid
When the user clicks through ""Try the new Routific""
Then they are logged into v3
And they have dispatcher and admin roles
But no read only role
And their plan in v3 is status-quo with no changes
And their v3 account is linked to their v2 account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: v2 shopify user with existing v3 account can try v3
Given a v3 account exists for a user's email
And the v2 user is set to paid
But no Stripe subscription exists
When the user clicks through ""Try the new Routific""
Then they are logged into v3
And they have dispatcher and admin roles
But no read only role
And their plan in v3 is status-quo with no changes
And their v3 account is linked to their v2 account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: v2 user with existing paid v3 account can try v3
Given a v3 account exists for a user's email
And the v3 plan is growth
When the user clicks through ""Try the new Routific""
Then they are logged into v3
And they have dispatcher and admin roles
But no read only role
And their plan in v3 is status-quo with no changes
And their v3 account is linked to their v2 account",Draft
962540,User Signup,2025-01-24T17:40:48.798Z,Signup,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User must complete captcha to sign up

column2: Given a user is not logged in
When a user fills out the sign up form
Then they must complete the captcha requirement to be able to complete sign up

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User is blocked from sign up if they fail captcha

column2: Given a user is not logged in
When a user fills out the sign up form
And they do not successfully complete the captcha requirement
Then they will be blocked and unable to complete sign up

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User is blocked from sign up via API

column2: When a user sends a properly formatted request to our sign up endpoint
Then they will be blocked and unable to complete sign up",Draft

column1: 133117,Sign up for account via the extension,2024-04-01T06:39:05.013Z,Authentication and access,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Sign up using Google SSO
Given user has installed the chrome extension
And does not have an existing account with the same email
When choosing to continue with Google
Then an account is created for the user
And the user is logged into the extension",Draft
133118,Log into the chrome extension,2024-04-01T06:50:58.120Z,Authentication and access,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Login using Google SSO

column2: Given has installed the chrome extension
And there is an existing account with the same email
When choosing to continue with Google
Then the user is logged into the extension",Draft

column1: 133119,Log out of the chrome extension,2024-04-01T06:52:47.624Z,Authentication and access,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Log out of the extension

column2: Given the user is currently logged into the extension
When user chooses to log out
Then they are logged out of the extension
And shown a button to sign back in",Draft

column1: 133126,Get an optimized route,2024-04-01T10:16:04.375Z,Optimize a route,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Optimize within the daily limits

column2: Given User is signed into the extension
And has not exceeded the daily usage limit
And has selected driving as the travel mode
And has enough input at least two stops
And the stops are not already in an optimized sequence
When user reuqests an optimization
Then they are returned an optimized route sequence
And the route is plotted on Google Maps UI in a new tab
And user is automatically navigated to the new tab
And shown comparison between the input route and the optimized route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Try to optimize without enough stops

column2: Given the user has set driving as the travel mode
When user inputs less that two stops in the google map UI
Then they can not request a route optimization
And shown feedback in the ui that at least two stops are needed

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Try to optimize after usage limited has been exhausted

column2: Given user has already requested 25 optimizations in the same day from the chrome extension
When user requests for the next optimization from the extension
Then they are blocked from getting any new optimization
And shown a feedback on the UI about exceeding the usage limit",Draft

column1: 133122,Avoid toll roads,2024-04-01T09:37:05.971Z,Adjust optimization preference,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Optimize while avoiding toll roads

column2: Given user has enough stops to optimize
And has set avoid toll roads on the google map UI
When user requests an optimization
Then they are returned an optimized route that avoids toll roads
And the route is plotted on google maps in a new tab
And user is automatically navigated to that tab
And shown a comparison between their input route and the optimized route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">
Scenario: One or more location is unreachable without using toll road

column2: Given the user has set avoid toll roads on the google map UI
And has input enough stops to optimize
And one or more of those stops  are unreachable without using a toll road

column1: When user requests an optimization
Then they are returned a route that avoids toll roads and excludes the unreachable location
And shown feedback that all stops could not be optimized",Draft
133121,Avoid ferries,2024-04-01T09:37:01.188Z,Adjust optimization preference,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Optimize while avoiding ferry

column2: Given user has enough stops to optimize
And has set avoid ferry on the google map UI
When user requests an optimization
Then they are returned an optimized route that avoids ferry
And the route is plotted on google maps in a new tab
And user is automatically navigated to that tab
And shown a comparison between their input route and the optimized route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: One or more location is unreachable without using ferry

column2: Given the user has set avoid ferry on the google map UI
And has input enough stops to optimize
And one or more of those stops  are unreachable without using a ferry

column1: When user requests an optimization
Then they are returned a route that avoids ferry and excludes the unreachable location
And shown feedback that all stops could not be optimized",Draft

133120,Set start and end location,2024-04-01T09:36:56.277Z,Adjust optimization preference,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: The first address is the staring point
Given the user has input more than two locations
And selected the option for route to start at the first address
When user requests an optimization
Then they are returned an optimized route starting at the first location
And the route is plotted on google maps in a new browser tab
And user is automatically navigated to that tab
And shown a comparison between their input route and the optimized route
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: The last address is the ending point
Given the user has input more than two locations
And selected the option for route to end at the last address
When user requests an optimization
Then they are returned an optimized route ending at the last location
And the route is plotted on google maps in a new browser tab
And user is automatically navigated to that tab
And shown a comparison between their input route and the optimized route",Draft
133127,Avoid highways,2024-04-01T22:03:50.830Z,Adjust optimization preference,"<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Try to optimize avoiding highways

column2: Given user has enough stops to optimize
When user sets avoid highways on the google map UI
Then they are blocked from requesting an optimized route
And shown feedback that we do not support avoiding highways",Draft

column1: 133128,Use different travel mode,2024-04-01T22:05:29.855Z,Adjust optimization preference,,Draft
